content.description: Face with cool features and an arête on the right side. The sit start goes much harder at V3 or so.
content.location: Right of the thin hands problem.

content.description: Fun sit start addition to The Warm Up

Stand start with right-hand on low sidepull crimp and left-hand on gaston sloper crimp, find low left foot smear and tricky right foot chip. Move left hand to a second higher gaston and right hand to pinch the arete, deadpoint or dyno to the lip and mantle on the slope.
content.location: The face between right-leaning crack and the warm-up

content.description: Thin hands crack. Stay straight in for the best challenge.
content.location: Right of right leaning crack and left of the warm up.

content.description: Staying off of the Right Leaning Crack, sit start at a low left hand side pull and sloping right hand crimp. Reach up to the perfect sloper and do some footwork to get your feet high. Get your left hand on the smallish sloper and make a big blind throw for the pocket. Make sure to stay off of the juggy lip of "right leaning crack".
content.location: Left side of Pacific Street Wall.

content.description: Climb the arête from a sit start. This arête is the right hand side of the warm up problem. There is a triangle boulder in the landing use caution.
content.location: Right side of the right arête of the warm up problem.

content.description: Stem the dihedral left of Nemesis.
content.location: Right of Crack Face and left of Nemesis.

content.description: Sit start at the bottom of an obvious right leaning crack. Ascend to a hard mantle top out or some trickery can be done to gain a pocket.
content.location: Right of the Quarry Pinch problem.

content.description: Starting on D.D.P. traverse the entire Pacific Street Wall into Quarry Pinch sit.
Sit start the same as Right Leaning Crack. Traverse underclings and reach up to the pinch. Make the crux move to the incut crimp and top it out.
content.location: the overhanging part of the pacific street wall

content.description: Also known as Pinscar Crack, this is the obvious finger crack on the far right of Pacific Street Wall.

Many variations of the Pacific Street Traverse.

Most start with the Dragons Neck Traverse V0 on the left side, making delicate moves right past undercling to jugs.

High Pacific Street Traverse V3-5 Do dragons neck but continue to the corner, at the corner pull onto sloping lip at right (I like to dyno it) do moves with few feet to reach a good hold on lip and geet feet right into leaning crack. A powerful slap to a rounded jug leads to fun moves on the positively cut lip continue around the final arete and top out or step off near Pinscar Crack.
content.protection: maybe a pad but not necessary
content.location: Left most side of Pacific Street Wall.

content.description:
Sit start same as Story In Stone (left hand sidepull right hand sloper crimp) into a match on the high sloper then full dyno to the right onto the large slopey lip left of the warm up crack, top out. Right Leaning Crack and the whole lip above it is off.

Beta Video:

youtu.be/hXviD89a0c8
content.location: Middle of the roadside facing wall between the right leaning crack and the warm up crack

content.description: This is a no hands traverse, so a true send is constituted by not touching the rock with your hands at all! Knees are fine on this though. The traverse goes from left to right and is started by stepping from the "starting block" at the far left onto the low edges of the wall, avoiding the large feet. Follow small edges along the wall before "topping out" at the far right side before the tree. You can make the traverse as short as you like, but the longer you wait to top out, the harder it gets. This is a great problem for practicing footwork, as you need to be very precise to avoid falling off.
content.protection: A couple pads I guess, but you're never more than a few feet off the ground.
content.location: Right behind you if you're looking at Desperado and Crack Face, just to the right of Nemesis.

climbs.name: dragons neck to pin-scar top out traverse

content.description: start on dragons neck traverse then go into high pacific street until the arete. from the arete stay low to join pinscar crack and top out.
content.protection: a pad for the pinscar top out
content.location: spans entire length of the pacific street wall

content.description: Start on the left side, make delicate moves right past undercling to jugs.
content.location: Extreme left side of Pacific Street Wall.

content.description: Sit start the vert face in between the left arête and the Crack Face V0 problem. Go straight up on slopers and hard to spot crimps and snatch the lip. Fun and classic.
content.location: Between Sit Down and Shut Up V2 and Crack Face V0.

content.description: Sit start the arête and make a "double dead point" to good holds near the lip using the arête for your left hand. Watch the landing.
content.location: Right side of the right hand arête of Nemesis.

content.description: Sit start Crack Face avoid the big feet at the start and climb the golden wall. There's a sloping crimp for your right hand and use the arete for your left hand. There is a desperate move near the lip.
Sweet face with tons of eliminates from V0- V4ish. There is two arête type features on this face. Great place to warm up.
content.location: Face in between Sit down and Shut Up to the dihedral.

content.description: A complete compression version of Nemesis, it's a little punchy.  Big slaps on slopey crimps for your right hand, while quick jabs at the crack with your left hand.
content.location: Sit start, left hand in the Nemesis crack, right hand down low at the slopey crimps.
